messages.title: A record of action in St Albans
messages.content: When the going got tough for commuters, Sandy waited for Susie in brimming Government minister Norman Kramer to St Albans to see for herself what commuters have put to put with.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Aims to balance the budget and eliminate the structural deficit by 2018.
Proposes a tax cut for local workers to the tune of £400.
Promises more support for the local pupils in education.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: St Albans Hospital under threat again?
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Highlights the ongoing review threat to St Albans Hospital and promises to safeguard it.

mentions.tacticalSituation: It's so close in St Albans! A choice between the Lib Dems and Conservatives here. Greens or Labour put the Tories back in.

housing.content: Sandy Walkington started his own working life as an apprentice at a building firm. The Government is providing 1,860 new apprenticeships in St Albans since April 2010.

endorsements.endorsement: As a mum with a young child I care about our quality of life. Sandy is part of the Green Alliance and a consistent champion.
I'm backing Sandy because as a local councillor - what counts the quality of life. Certainly not the party politics.

images.caption: Sandy Walkington is featured in various actions and interactions with the public.

leaflet.additionalNotes: There are also District Council elections too!
